intro: Heliophytum molle, commonly known as the soft heliophyte, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun exposure. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted for water storage, while its flowers are often yellow or orange, attracting pollinators. Heliophytum molle is appreciated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid environments.
